CHARACTER4268134.goal: create a prosperous, successful family or community
CHARACTER4268134.aka: The boss, leader, aristocrat, king, queen, politician, role model, manager or administrator.

antagonist.description: the primary bad guy. The character that opposes the protagonist outright on all counts, physically and emotionally.

CHARACTER0358095.greatest fear: to be punished for doing something bad or wrong
CHARACTER0358095.weakness: their naive innocence can be boring or lack realism
CHARACTER0358095.aka: The utopian, the traditionalist, naive, mystic, saint, romantic, dreamer.

CHARACTER8642216.goal: to experience a better, more authentic, more fulfilling life

foil.description: a supporting character who has a contrasting personality and set of values to the protaganist. Putting the foil and main character in close proximity helps draw readers’ attention to the latter’s attributes.

antagonist.description: the primary bad guy. The character that opposes the protagonist outright on all counts, physically and emotionally.

CHARACTER8642216.desire: the freedom to find out who you are through exploring the world
CHARACTER8642216.biggest fear: getting trapped, conformity, and inner emptiness
CHARACTER8642216.strategy: journey, seeking out and experiencing new things, escape from boredom
CHARACTER8642216.talent: autonomy, ambition, being true to one's soul
CHARACTER8642216.aka: The seeker, iconoclast, wanderer, individualist, pilgrim.

CHARACTER7583364.goal: to have a great time and lighten up the world

logical.description: the rational thinker who plans things out, shoots for logical solutions and gives reasonable, matter-of-fact answers to questions. However, sometimes the head needs to listen to the heart to work at its best.

CHARACTER7583364.desire: to live in the moment with full enjoyment
CHARACTER7583364.aka: The fool, trickster, joker, practical joker or comedian.

CHARACTER3707393.goal: expert mastery in a way that improves the world

skeptic.description: the lone objector. The skeptic does not believe in the theme nor in the importance of achieving the protagonist’s goal. Without loyalties, the skeptic is on his/her own path. The skeptic may like the protagonist and want the protagonist to succeed but not at the cost of the skeptic’s goals. However, the skeptic may have a change of heart by the end of the story.

CHARACTER3707393.desire: to prove one's worth through courageous acts
CHARACTER3707393.strategy: to be as strong and competent as possible
CHARACTER3707393.weakness: arrogance, always needing another battle to fight
CHARACTER3707393.aka: The warrior, crusader, rescuer, superhero, the soldier, dragon slayer, the winner and the team player.

protagonist.description: the character responsible for handling the main problem and the one most in need of change, emotionally.

CHARACTER3682296.desire: understanding the fundamental laws of the universe
CHARACTER3682296.strategy: develop a vision and live by it
CHARACTER3682296.aka: The visionary, catalyst, inventor, charismatic leader, shaman, healer, medicine man.

CHARACTER1196707.goal: to have a great time and lighten up the world
CHARACTER1196707.desire: to live in the moment with full enjoyment
CHARACTER1196707.aka: The fool, trickster, joker, practical joker or comedian.

mentor.description: the protagonist’s conscience and the prevailing side to the thematic argument. The mentor voices or represents the lesson that must be learned by the protagonist in order to change for the better and achieve the goal. (Note: Be mindful of creating a mentor who is as perfect and principled as humans can be, for doing so will make the character seem inhuman. Instead, let the mentor be flawed, like all us humans.)

CHARACTER5614403.greatest fear: to be left out or to stand out from the crowd
CHARACTER5614403.strategy: to develop ordinary solid virtues, be down to earth, the common touch
CHARACTER5614403.weakness: losing one's own self in an effort to blend in or for the sake of superficial relationships
CHARACTER5614403.aka: The good old boy, everyman, the person next door, the realist, the solid citizen, the good neighbour, the silent majority.

CHARACTER4547004.goal: create a prosperous, successful family or community

emotional.description: this character acts according to their gut and lets motions fuel decisions. Impulsive. Reactive. Sometimes the emotional character is right and succeeds in ways that a thinking person would never have even tried, but sometimes the character finds trouble by not thinking before jumping.

antagonist.description: the primary bad guy. The character that opposes the protagonist outright on all counts, physically and emotionally.

CHARACTER4547004.aka: The boss, leader, aristocrat, king, queen, politician, role model, manager or administrator.

temptor.description: the right-hand to the antagonist. The tempter doesn’t need to know the antagonist, but they both stand for the same thing: stopping the protagonist from achieving the protagonist’s goal. The tempter tries to manipulate and convince the protagonist to join the “dark side”. However, in the end, the tempter can change his/her mind and realize the benefit of joining the good guys.

CHARACTER6549873.greatest fear: to be punished for doing something bad or wrong
CHARACTER6549873.weakness: their naive innocence can be boring or lack realism
CHARACTER6549873.aka: The utopian, the traditionalist, naive, mystic, saint, romantic, dreamer.

CHARACTER4253393.goal: being in a relationship with people, work and surroundings they love

catalyst.description: the character in a story who causes the protagonist, or main character, to move toward some kind of action or transformation. This character is usually the person that spends the most quality and influential time with the protagonist.

CHARACTER4253393.greatest fear: being alone, a wallflower, unwanted, unloved
CHARACTER4253393.strategy: to become more and more physically and emotionally attractive
CHARACTER4253393.weakness: outward-directed desire to please others at risk of losing own identity
CHARACTER4253393.aka: The partner, friend, intimate, enthusiast, sensualist, spouse, team-builder.

protagonist.description: the character responsible for handling the main problem and the one most in need of change, emotionally.

antagonist.description: the primary bad guy. The character that opposes the protagonist outright on all counts, physically and emotionally.

mentor.description: the protagonist’s conscience and the prevailing side to the thematic argument. The mentor voices or represents the lesson that must be learned by the protagonist in order to change for the better and achieve the goal. (Note: Be mindful of creating a mentor who is as perfect and principled as humans can be, for doing so will make the character seem inhuman. Instead, let the mentor be flawed, like all us humans.)

temptor.description: the right-hand to the antagonist. The tempter doesn’t need to know the antagonist, but they both stand for the same thing: stopping the protagonist from achieving the protagonist’s goal. The tempter tries to manipulate and convince the protagonist to join the “dark side”. However, in the end, the tempter can change his/her mind and realize the benefit of joining the good guys.

skeptic.description: the lone objector. The skeptic does not believe in the theme nor in the importance of achieving the protagonist’s goal. Without loyalties, the skeptic is on his/her own path. The skeptic may like the protagonist and want the protagonist to succeed but not at the cost of the skeptic’s goals. However, the skeptic may have a change of heart by the end of the story.

emotional.description: this character acts according to their gut and lets motions fuel decisions. Impulsive. Reactive. Sometimes the emotional character is right and succeeds in ways that a thinking person would never have even tried, but sometimes the character finds trouble by not thinking before jumping.

logical.description: the rational thinker who plans things out, shoots for logical solutions and gives reasonable, matter-of-fact answers to questions. However, sometimes the head needs to listen to the heart to work at its best.

foil.description: a supporting character who has a contrasting personality and set of values to the protaganist. Putting the foil and main character in close proximity helps draw readers’ attention to the latter’s attributes.

catalyst.description: the character in a story who causes the protagonist, or main character, to move toward some kind of action or transformation. This character is usually the person that spends the most quality and influential time with the protagonist.

goal.description: character wants something on the scene level that will ultimately help him reach his overall plot goal—and he tries to get it

conflict.description: character is met with an obstacle to obtaining his goal

outcome.description: usually disastrous, in the sense that the character does not achieve the goal or achieves only part of it

passage_pair.description: Passage pairs are made up of a scene and a sequel.

delemma.description: character must figure out  how to overcome the new complications and still move forward toward his main plot goal

decision.description: character decides upon a new scene goal to cope with the new complications and move forward toward the main plot goal in a—hopefully—more effective way
